pull.title: test: Enable SC2046 and SC2086 shellcheck rules
pull.body:
Closes #20879.
Replaces #22695.

**Note for reviewers**. Some touched shell scripts are not being run in CI, therefore they require more thorough reviewing:
- `contrib/devtools/gen-manpages.sh`
- `contrib/macdeploy/detached-sig-apply.sh`
- `contrib/windeploy/detached-sig-create.sh`
- `src/qt/res/animation/makespinner.sh`

events.body:
Since you are already touching the ci scripts with double quotes  `"` 
Maybe add `"` around the  `cd P_CI_DIR` in  DOCKER_EXEC function: 

```
DOCKER_CI_CMD_PREFIX bash -c "export PATH=$BASE_SCRATCH_DIR/bins/:\$PATH && cd \"$P_CI_DIR\" && $*"
```

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#23506](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23506) (test: Make more shell scripts verifiable by the `shellcheck` tool by hebasto)
* [#21002](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21002) (script: improve scripted-diff check by 4D617278)
* [#19952](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19952) (build, ci: Add file-based logging for individual packages by hebasto)
* [#19013](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19013) (test: add v0.20.1, v0.21.0 and v22.0 to backwards compatibility test by Sjors)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

Updated 02e9579cecc8002e37013dc11a0b7ab5b7a90d42 -> 27fbb10cbc5fb82e52e5b62dc34cd5c5c729452e ([pr23462.03](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr23462.03) -> [pr23462.04](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr23462.04)):

- rebased due to the conflict with #23458
- addressed @dougEfresh's [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23462#issuecomment-962671897)

tACK 27fbb10cbc5fb82e52e5b62dc34cd5c5c729452e

Tested on macOS v12.0.1 (21A559)

Successfully tested the following files locally and can verify the SC2046 & SC2086 warnings fixed:

> **Note**: On macOS, the default `sed` triggers an error when running `gen-manpages.sh`. This is resolved by using the GNU version `gnu-sed` instead (i.e. install and prepend its path in `PATH` to override the default `sed`). Running `src/qt/res/animation/makespinner.sh` also requires `imagemagick`. `contrib/macdeploy/detached-sig-apply.sh` requires [signapple](https://github.com/achow101/signapple) installed.

- contrib/devtools/gen-manpages.sh
- src/qt/res/animation/makespinner.sh
- contrib/macdeploy/detached-sig-apply.sh

**PS**: the minor notes above are intended only for those who haven't run these files before on macOS.

> Note: On macOS, the default sed triggers an error when running gen-manpages.sh.

Wrt general gen-manpages.sh frustrations: please see #22681. The sed parts are likely going to be removed completely before 0.23.

Concept ACK, unintentional globbing and word splitting lead to inscrutable bugs.

We should mark with a `disable=` wherever we need them or simply use arrays.

> Using arrays sounds like a good idea to me. At least for scripts like this that explicitly need `bash`.

> We should mark with a `disable=` wherever we need them or simply use arrays.

Could we leave introducing arrays for a follow up?

> Could we leave introducing arrays for a follow up?

Fine with me. Merging this soon closes off new such issues being introduced. And it's already the second try.

events.body:
Updated 27fbb10cbc5fb82e52e5b62dc34cd5c5c729452e -> fe0ff569ea6c353f88609c0f5f9b6fa80ff74f15 ([pr23462.04](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr23462.04) -> [pr23462.05](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr23462.05)):

- rebased due to the conflict with #23114
- the second commit has been re-worked, and discovered bugs have been fixed

> What is the idea of disabling these specific checks in some places?

Now this PR introduces `# shellcheck disable=SC2046` in two places only:
- `contrib/windeploy/detached-sig-create.sh` is not a `bash` script, that is required to use arrays
- in `test/lint/lint-python.sh` too much hassle is required to avoid it

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -15,5 +15,5 @@ export RUN_UNIT_TESTS_SEQUENTIAL="true"

 export RUN_UNIT_TESTS="false"

-export BITCOIN_CONFIG="--enable-zmq --with-libs=no --with-gui=qt5 --enable-reduce-exports

comments.body: Ok, was just wondering if there is a difference.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -15,5 +15,5 @@ export RUN_UNIT_TESTS_SEQUENTIAL="true"
 export RUN_UNIT_TESTS="false"
 export GOAL="install"
 export PREVIOUS_RELEASES_TO_DOWNLOAD="v0.15.2 v0.16.3 v0.17.2 v0.18.1 v0.19.1 v0.20.1"
-export BITCOIN_CONFIG="--enable-zmq --with-libs=no --with-gui=qt5 --enable-reduce-exports
+export BITCOIN_CONFIG="--enable-zmq --with-libs=no --with-gui=qt5 --enable-reduce-exports \
comments.body:
More details.

Being quoted, the `"$BITCOIN_CONFIG` preserves the `newline` character.

Now it is [treated](https://www.gnu.org/software/bash/manual/html_node/Escape-Character.html#Escape-Character) as a line continuation.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -12,6 +12,7 @@ fi
 
 if [ "$CI_OS_NAME" == "macos" ]; then
   sudo -H pip3 install --upgrade pip
+  # shellcheck disable=SC2086
comments.body: What is the idea of disabling these specific checks in some places? Is the idea that these are temporary and need to be fixed later? (but too much hassle to fix in this PR?)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -12,6 +12,7 @@ fi
 
 if [ "$CI_OS_NAME" == "macos" ]; then
   sudo -H pip3 install --upgrade pip
+  # shellcheck disable=SC2086
comments.body:
> What is the idea of disabling these specific checks in some places?

```bash
$ PIP_PACKAGES="zmq lief"
$ pip3 install --user "$PIP_PACKAGES"
ERROR: Invalid requirement: 'zmq lief'
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -12,6 +12,7 @@ fi
 
 if [ "$CI_OS_NAME" == "macos" ]; then
   sudo -H pip3 install --upgrade pip
+  # shellcheck disable=SC2086
comments.body: So some code can *inherently* not be written to conform to SC2086?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -12,6 +12,7 @@ fi
 
 if [ "$CI_OS_NAME" == "macos" ]; then
   sudo -H pip3 install --upgrade pip
+  # shellcheck disable=SC2086
comments.body: Looks like that. And that code requires `# shellcheck disable=SC2086`.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -12,6 +12,7 @@ fi
 
 if [ "$CI_OS_NAME" == "macos" ]; then
   sudo -H pip3 install --upgrade pip
+  # shellcheck disable=SC2086

@@ -12,6 +12,7 @@ fi
 
 if [ "$CI_OS_NAME" == "macos" ]; then
   sudo -H pip3 install --upgrade pip
+  # shellcheck disable=SC2086
comments.body:
This works:
```bash
$ PIP_PACKAGES=(zmq lief)
$ pip3 install --user "${PIP_PACKAGES[@]}"
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -12,6 +12,7 @@ fi
 
 if [ "$CI_OS_NAME" == "macos" ]; then
   sudo -H pip3 install --upgrade pip
+  # shellcheck disable=SC2086
comments.body: Using arrays sounds like a good idea to me. At least for scripts like this that explicitly need `bash`.
